comment: Don't take a class from someone who writes the book. This gives teachers the illusion they're always right. If she thinks your discussion post is more of an opinion, she'll just give you a 33% because it's not to her liking.

Weekly quizzes with LockDown (not everything is searchable), weekly reading discussions, and a group project—even for online classes. You can complete quizzes and discussions ahead of time. She's slow to respond to emails, but creates a GroupMe where you can remind her. She does offers great opportunities to break into the sports industry.

No lectures, just reading the textbook. Quizzes each week on lockdown with camera based on text book chapters which are around 20 pages each. Discussion posts each week which is the only easy part. need to do 10 hours of volunteer work as a project. I do not recommend taking as an elective. She also takes forever to respond to emails.
Have not taken professor, but I can't remove my comment. wrong professor

She lays out the assignments and quizzes basically the first day. Quizzes are generally 10 questions(require lockdown browser + webcam). She offered so much fun volunteer extra credit, if you don't do too well in the fall or spring you can still pass with an A from extra credit alone. Gave me an extra chance to complete an assignment. Awesome
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Butler brings years of experience to the classroom. Her lectures for SM 2100 were more discussion based, and she had plenty of guest speakers to talk about their experience in the sports industry. Class attendance is extremely important.
Great Professor. Literally super transparent and very professional. Definitely take her!

I took her Intro to Sport Management class. She told us to get a textbook but I never used it and still got an A. She wants everyone in the class to know everyone else so she gives a lot of group projects but they're pretty interesting projects. Her class is fairly lecture heavy but she does a good job not making it boring.
Great professor, love this class, very interactive and thought provoking. Highly recommend this class and Dr. Butler. She is professional, caring, fair, and makes everyone feel comfortable.
